availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward Baker, Jr. (Caldwell County, Kentucky, soldier and saloon owner)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, silversmith, soldier, and saloon owner. Native of England. Son of Edward Baker, Sr. Silversmith in Caldwell County in 1860. Served as a private in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A) from October 9, 1861 to July 28, 1862. Wounded and captured at the Battle of Sacramento, Kentucky, on December 28, 1861. Discharged on account of medical disability on July 28, 1862. Saloon owner in Caldwell County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell, Princeton, p. 107.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0474.
KYR-0001-005-0091.
